name: (R) ESTAR GSHP (Other Fossil Furnace)
_description: ENERGY STAR ground source heat pump fully replacing original fuel oil/propane furnace

notes: 2022 ENERGY STAR v3.2 performance level residential ground:source heat pumps

notes: Retail (new) and total installed (existing) cost for ENERGY STAR GSHPs in 2022
For existing buildings, added costs of $6300 are the average of the cost range for circuit breaker panel upgrade and home service upgrade costs in the NV5 report
a new circuit cost of 700 $2022 using the upper bound (assuming a high amperage 240V circuit is required for the HVAC system) from the NV5 report
and additional tank removal costs of 800 2014$ (975 2022$) are applied for distillate and propane based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022.

market_scaling_fractions_source.notes: Heating multiple of 80% was determined as proportion of total homes with non-NG fossil-based heating that have both cooling and heating systems (1,968 homes out of 2,451 homes with non-NG fossil heating and cooling). Cooling multiple of 8% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a cooling system (16,171 homes) where there is heating via a heating energy source other than natural gas, electricity, or biomass AND heating is done via non:steam/hot water system (1,338 homes).
